result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be paid by April 1, 2015 or penalty of 8 days Huber for non-payment.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Exhibits 1-4 from Preliminary Hearing held on 4/4/14 - Destroyed pursuant to statute
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael A Andrews in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following: 
- Fine totaling: $379.00 to be paid by April 1, 2015; alternate 8 days Huber 
- DNA Surcharge waived

- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant after 2 years and upon payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant Michael A Andrews in court with attorney Maura A. McMahon.  Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Matthew Seeger from the Village of Hartland Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over. Atty. McMahon objects to bind over. Court finds due to statutory changes that law was in effect of filing sufficient basis. Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
